intro: Oreopanax lawrancei, commonly known as the Lawrence's sycogatta, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately compound leaves and produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and plant collectors.
